title: Epic: Task-based delegation extension for pi
description:
Replace persona-based subagent extension with task-based delegation system.

## Goals
1. Task types with minimal contracts (policy, not persona)
2. Difficulty-based model selection (small/medium/large)
3. Skill injection into workers
4. Session continuation via session_id
5. No sandbox policies (for now)
6. No personas - workers execute WHAT, not WHO they are

## Architecture
- **Task Type**: Policy (model, tools, thinking) + default skills
- **Skill**: Injectable knowledge from ~/.pi/agent/skills/ or .pi/skills/
- **Task Session**: Durable transcript, resumable via session_id
- **Worker**: Executes task with context prompt (not identity persona)

## Built-in Task Types
- code: General implementation work
- search: Find code, definitions, references (read-only tools)
- review: Code review with review skill
- planning: Architecture and design decisions
- general: User-specified skills

## Config (settings.json)
```json
{
  "tasks": {
    "code": {
      "difficulty": {
        "small": { "model": "anthropic/claude-haiku-4" },
        "medium": { "model": "anthropic/claude-sonnet-4" },
        "large": { "model": "anthropic/claude-sonnet-4", "thinking": "high" }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## DoD
- New extension in tau/extensions/task/
- Old subagent extension removed from ~/.pi
- task tool registered and working
- Skill injection functional
- Session continuation working
- Custom TUI rendering for task results
close_reason: Implemented task-based delegation extension and removed old subagent

title: Create extension scaffold: tau/extensions/task/
description:
Create the basic extension structure.

## Files to create
```
tau/extensions/task/
├── package.json          # Extension manifest with pi.extensions
└── src/
    ├── index.ts          # Extension entry point
    └── types.ts          # TypeScript interfaces
```

## package.json structure
```json
{
  "name": "task",
  "private": true,
  "type": "module",
  "pi": {
    "extensions": ["./src/index.ts"]
  }
}
```

## index.ts minimal scaffold
- Import ExtensionAPI from @mariozechner/pi-coding-agent
- Export default function that takes pi: ExtensionAPI
- Log 'task extension loaded' on session_start

## DoD
- Extension loads without errors when pi starts
- session_start event fires and logs message

title: Create review skill from old review agent
description:
Migrate review agent content to a proper skill.

## Source
Check ~/.pi/agent/extensions/subagent/agents/ or ~/.pi/agent/agents/ for review.md

## Target
~/.pi/agent/skills/review/SKILL.md

## Skill format
```markdown
---
name: review
description: Code review guidelines and output format
---

# Code Review Skill

{extracted guidelines from old review.md}

## Output Format
{any structured output requirements}
```

## Key content to preserve
- Review process guidelines
- What to look for (bugs, security, style)
- Output format/structure expectations

## What to remove
- Identity prompts ('You are a code reviewer...')
- Persona language
- Redundant instructions covered by task context

## DoD
- review skill exists at correct path
- loadSkill('review', cwd) returns content
- No persona language in skill content
close_reason: Migrated review agent into review skill (plus planning/search skills)

title: Implement TaskRegistry: load built-in + user config
close_reason: Implemented TaskRegistry with config overrides and difficulty resolution

title: Implement SkillLoader: load skills from disk
description:
Create SkillLoader that finds and loads skill content.

## File: src/skills.ts

## LoadedSkill interface
```typescript
interface LoadedSkill {
  name: string;
  path: string;
  contents: string;
}
```

## Search paths (in order of priority)
1. .pi/skills/{name}/SKILL.md (project-local)
2. .pi/skills/{name}.md
3. ~/.pi/agent/skills/{name}/SKILL.md (user)
4. ~/.pi/agent/skills/{name}.md

## API
- loadSkill(name: string, cwd: string): LoadedSkill | null
- loadSkills(names: string[], cwd: string): { loaded: LoadedSkill[], missing: string[] }

## DoD
- Can load beads skill from ~/.pi/agent/skills/beads/SKILL.md
- Project-local skills take precedence
- Returns null for missing skills without throwing

title: Implement SessionManager: track active task sessions
description:
Create SessionManager for session continuation.

## File: src/sessions.ts

## TaskSession interface
```typescript
interface TaskSession {
  sessionId: string;
  taskType: string;
  difficulty: Difficulty;
  process: ChildProcess;       // spawned pi process
  createdAt: number;
}
```

## In-memory storage
- Map<sessionId, TaskSession>
- Sessions live for duration of parent pi process

## API
- getSession(sessionId): TaskSession | undefined
- createSession(taskType, difficulty): TaskSession
- hasSession(sessionId): boolean

## Session ID generation
- Use crypto.randomUUID() for new sessions
- Accept existing sessionId for continuation

## DoD
- Can create new session and retrieve by ID
- Can detect session_id mismatch (wrong task_type)
- Sessions survive across multiple task tool calls
close_reason: Implemented SessionManager for task session tracking

title: Implement TaskRunner: spawn and stream pi processes
description:
Create TaskRunner that spawns worker pi processes.

## File: src/runner.ts

## Core responsibilities
1. Build worker system prompt (context, not persona)
2. Spawn pi process with correct flags
3. Stream JSON events back to parent
4. Handle completion/error/interruption

## Worker system prompt structure
```
# Task Execution Context
You are executing a delegated task from parent session: {parentSessionId}

## Guidelines
- Focus on the requested task
- Use available tools as needed
- If specific output format required, follow it exactly
- Otherwise, summarize what you did and why

{parallel_constraints if parallelCount > 1}

---
<skill name="{name}" path="{path}">
{skill contents}
</skill>
```

## pi spawn arguments
```bash
pi --mode json -p --no-session \
  --model {resolvedModel} \
  --thinking {resolvedThinking} \
  --tools {toolsList} \
  --append-system-prompt {tempPromptFile} \
  "Task: {userPrompt}"
```

## Event processing
- Parse NDJSON from stdout
- Emit updates via onUpdate callback
- Accumulate messages for final result
- Track usage stats (tokens, cost)

## TaskResult
```typescript
type TaskOutput =
  | { type: 'completed'; message: string }
  | { type: 'completed_tool'; toolOutput: string }
  | { type: 'completed_empty' }
  | { type: 'interrupted'; resumable: true }
  | { type: 'failed'; reason: string; resumable: boolean };

interface TaskResult {
  output: TaskOutput;
  sessionId: string;
  usage: UsageStats;
}
```

## DoD
- Can spawn pi process and capture output
- Streams progress to parent via onUpdate
- Handles all termination cases (success, error, abort)
- Cleans up temp files on completion
close_reason: Implemented TaskRunner to spawn pi workers and stream NDJSON

title: Register task tool with pi.registerTool()
close_reason: Registered task tool and wired registry/skills/sessions/runner

title: Implement custom TUI rendering for task results
description:
Add custom renderCall and renderResult for nice TUI display.

## File: src/render.ts

## renderCall display
Show task being delegated:
```
• task review:medium
  └ "Review changes in src/foo.rs"
```

## renderResult display (collapsed)
```
✓ task review:medium (session: abc-123)
  └ 3 turns ↑1.2k ↓800 $0.0042 anthropic/claude-sonnet-4
  └ Found 2 issues: missing error handling, unused import
```

## renderResult display (expanded)
Show full message content with markdown rendering.

## Streaming display (isPartial)
```
⏳ task review:medium (running...)
  └ read src/foo.rs
  └ grep "error" ./
  └ ...
```

## Status indicators
- ⏳ Running (blinking dot like current subagent)
- ✓ Completed (green)
- ✗ Failed (red)
- ⚠ Interrupted (yellow)

## DoD
- renderCall shows task_type:difficulty and description
- renderResult shows completion status and summary
- Streaming updates show tool calls as they happen
- Expanded view shows full output with markdown
close_reason: Added custom TUI rendering for task call/result

title: Remove old subagent extension from ~/.pi
description:
Clean up the old persona-based subagent extension.

## Files to remove
```
~/.pi/agent/extensions/subagent/
├── agents.ts      # DELETE
├── index.ts       # DELETE
├── README.md      # DELETE
├── agents/        # DELETE entire directory
└── prompts/       # DELETE entire directory
```

## Files to keep (migrate if useful)
- agents/*.md content → Consider migrating to skills if valuable
  - review.md → ~/.pi/agent/skills/review/SKILL.md (if not already exists)
  - Other agents: evaluate if content is useful as skills

## Verification
- pi starts without subagent tool
- No errors about missing extension
- task tool works as replacement

## DoD
- ~/.pi/agent/extensions/subagent/ directory removed
- Old 'subagent' tool no longer available
- Any useful agent content migrated to skills
close_reason: Removed old subagent extension and installed task extension symlink

title: Add parallel worker detection and constraints
description:
Detect when multiple task calls are in same parent turn.

## Purpose
When LLM calls task() multiple times in parallel, inject constraints to prevent conflicts.

## Detection
- Track task tool invocations per parent turn
- Count concurrent workers spawned

## Parallel constraints prompt (injected when parallelCount > 1)
```
## Parallel Execution ({parallelCount} workers)
This parent spawned {parallelCount} task sessions in parallel.
- Assume other workers may be editing the repo at the same time.
- Avoid editing the same files or shared contracts unless explicitly required.
- Keep changes narrowly scoped to your assigned area.
- If you detect overlap or a dependency on another worker, stop and report it.
```

## Implementation
- Use atomic counter per turn context
- Increment on each task tool call
- Finalize count before spawning any workers
- Inject constraints if count > 1

## DoD
- Single task call: no parallel constraints injected
- Multiple parallel calls: all workers see constraint prompt
- Count is accurate even with concurrent calls
close_reason: Added parallel worker detection and constraint prompt injection

title: Fix worked-for prompt causing infinite generation
description: Rendering 'Worked for …' looks fine, but the data/prompt being sent to the model appears to include a recursive or unbounded representation (possibly a function, HTML, or repeating string) causing the model to never stop talking. Investigate worked-for.ts prompt construction + call sites and fix to send bounded, plain-text content.
